website_summaries.verdict: A good replacement pump with enough horsepower to handle smaller pools, though its lifespan may be shorter than expected.
pros: Strainer top is easy to open
cons: Pump’s lifespan is fairly short, lasting less than 2 years for some
Not powerful enough for some pools

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Useful Life
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pump in June of 2015. In the past, my pool pump motors have lasted 5 years or more. This pump motor failed after 27 months, 10 months of which it was not used, as the pool is closed for the winter months. Not the quality I expected out of Hayward equipment. To those of you who would blame the operator, I have owned and maintained this pool for over ten years. I have regular inspections performed by a Hayward certified pool professional. The pump is out of the elements inside a small garage. This motor should not have failed this quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a disaster.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this pump and went to install it and there are no fittings included. The previous Hayward Max Flo XL pump that this one is replacing came with all necessary fittings. So I ordered the fittings and waited they came in this week so I installed the pump today and paid an electrician to wire it and could never get it to prime. So I disconnected the plumbing and hooked it up to some 1.5" industrial hose and placed the other end in the pool and it still would not prime in a reasonable time. No choice now but to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: tcjack

customer_reviews.title: Don't depend on warranty coverage!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Hayward products with my pool for many years. This purchase however, was a huge disappointed. The seal inside was kinked and was leaking after installation. I contacted the manufacturer since this was a warranty issue. I was told I had to use one of their service centers to replace the part. I contacted the service center and was told the labor was not included, then was told the seals were not covered under the warranty. Really? Amost 400 bucks and it is not covered??! Bad business!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Price

customer_reviews.title: The voltage options on the pump were mislabeled. The ...
customer_reviews.text: The voltage options on the pump were mislabeled. The pump was tripping the breaker when hooked to the labeled voltage connection. When switched to what would be the wrong voltage the issue was resolved. I bought an s200 pump as well and its function labeling was installed backwards as well. Causing our pool to be contaminated with a cloud of new sand dust.
customer_reviews.author: DEAN CAUDILL

customer_reviews.title: Pump failed after 3 years of service!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordinally when I purchased this pump reviews were very positive.........The pump just stop working without any warning signs this past week. It does have some minor corrosion but this would be expected because I live in FL. However, it appears the motor isn't running I am waiting for repairman. When searching the warranty I see it's only for 1 year. I would not recommend buying this pump. A pump should last longer then 3 years........poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Lioi

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: Plug and Play.... I really wanted just the motor and pump, but has mine was 12 years old, I thought I would replace the complete pump/motor. Biggest hassle was I didn't plan on replacing the 90-degree connectors and getting them out of the old motor was a PITA. Save yourself the hassle and make sure you have a couple spare before starting the swap. Minus one start for the so-called "See-through strainer cover." IT'S NOT. Has a high tint and you would not be able to tell if it was full of BitCoins.
customer_reviews.author: TommieT

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but see comments
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a direct replacement for the pump/motor installed when my pool was built 3 years ago. The original equipment began to leak a year ago and I had to install a new seal around the drive shaft extending into the pump. Then, this year, the motor just quit. (Not happy with the durability of these components, but I decided to buy the same thing so I did not have to do extensive re-plumbing). So far, everything is running and working well. The wiring instructions are a little confusing, but I figured it out. We'll see how long this stuff works, this round.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Clark

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality I expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pump in May of 2017. This pump motor failed after 4 months, as the pool is closed for the winter months. Not the quality I expected out of Hayward equipment. I am trying to call customer service and wait time is about more than hours and its not worth it. This motor should not have failed this quickly
customer_reviews.author: Sav

customer_reviews.title: Complete Junk!
customer_reviews.text: 2nd one I have had, both lasted two years!! I would not put another one in if they gave it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Hope it lasts longer than 5 years!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third 1-1:2 hp Hayward pump in ten years, with the first two pumps only lasting five years each before bearings wearing out in the motor. Time will tell if this pump lasts five years, as I only have the pool open 3-4 months out of the year. Pump and packaging arrived in great condition, except that a swivel nut was broken and I had to rob a swivel nut off my old pump to secure the lid on the door to the lint trap. Here's to hoping for a longer pump/motor life expectancy.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: THUMBS DOWN AMAZON
customer_reviews.text: BOUGHT THIS IN APRIL LAST YEAR AND PRINTED WARRANTY OF PRODUCT LISTING AND NOW THAT THE PUMP IS NOT WORKING , I COME TO FIND OUT AMAZON LISTS THE WRONG WARRANTY TERMS . THIS UNIT IS ONLY WARRANTIED FOR 1 YEAR NOT 2 LIKE THE WARRANTY POSTED STATES.SO BESIDES THIS PUMP ONLY LASTING A YEAR THIS IS NOT A GOOD PUMP FOR THE MONEY.AND MAKES ME WONDER ABOUT BUYING ANYTHING THRU AMAZON THAT HAS A WARRANTY. 1 STAR AMAZON
customer_reviews.author: fun factory

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet and easy to install. Great warranty
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a Eco Kleer2 hp pump and filter by waterway. That unit didn’t make it 3 seasons. The Hayward is already super quiet compared to what I replaced when it was new. Easy to access filter strainer basket. It was a quick and easy swap. I did have to change the wiring from 220 to 120 volt. Very easy and I added a pig tail to plug it into my GFI Outlet. This pump out the gate has way more pumping power and makes quick time to recirculate my 28’ above ground pool. We have been very happy. The warranty is superior to what I had. This pump should outlast my cheap o one we had.
customer_reviews.author: Markeck911

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it.
customer_reviews.text: Had this pump less than a year and already stopped working. Of course Amazon says to call Hayward and Hayward says to call an authorized dealer and the dealer says we need the go back to where we bought it. Lots of finger pointing and of course we are left with a broken pump. Moral of the story is to buy your pump at a local pool store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Start Capacitor Failed after two years
customer_reviews.text: Terrible warranty, only good for one year. Keeps tripping my breaker, won't come on. Capacitor is not shorted, so something else is wrong. Update: upgrading my review, turns out it was the start capacitor after all. One star removed due to short warranty.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mack

customer_reviews.title: Hayward doesn’t warranty amazon bought !
customer_reviews.text: Had the pump 2 years and it failed after two years !! Hayward’s customer service is horrible , I bought a Hayward canister the rod that’s screws the top on became rusty and snapped off after a year ! Was told not a Hayward issue because I bought on amazon !! $80 rod ! Disappointed in company please buy the protection when buying this pump only thing that saved me from spending a lot of money !
customer_reviews.author: ShoeGal

customer_reviews.title: didn't last 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I've always had Hayward pumps. This one didn't even last 2 years! and I've already had to have all of the seals replaced. We have a large pool, 32,000 gallons, so the pumps is not oversized. Years ago our Hayward pumps would last years, but no longer. Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Gomeztsi

customer_reviews.title: Worked great all summer long
customer_reviews.text: Had this installed by a qualified professional at the beginning of 2016 pool season. Worked great all summer long. Just started to open up my pool for this season, and the pump started overheating after only 30 to 40 minutes of run time. Wasn't even used for one full year and already breaking. Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last as long as expected.
customer_reviews.text: The predecessor for this pool pump lasted a lot longer; with the rise in cost from $370 when I bought it 3 years ago, I would highly suggest purchasing another brand. When the pump failed, I disassembled it to find that the flat seal was kinked from the factory. Since I have a salt water pool, the small amount of water that made its way to the motor caused the pictured corrosion. The pump was quiet and powerful when it was functioning and was a suitable replacement for a previous Hayward pump.
customer_reviews.author: K. Gault

customer_reviews.title: Hayward super pump
customer_reviews.text: As the name implies, this is a really super pump ! I've owned it for three months and it's quiet and easy to install. So far so good. I've even noticed that my electric bill is down about $10 a month . I'll take $120 savings a year any day of the week That's at least 3 or 4 new dresses the wife can buy at TJ Maxx ! woooooo..
customer_reviews.author: godfatherfan

customer_reviews.title: Seems somewhat common for these to burn out within 1-2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Burned out after 2 years. Just bought a replacement motor for this pump today.
customer_reviews.author: PleasantlyPixie

customer_reviews.title: bad luck?
customer_reviews.text: i may just have bad luck but the motor just failed after installing july of last year, all properly installed and was not abused or run without water. set up to run 220v. After flipping the switch the motor made a humm and never spun over, check for debris ect and found nothing out of the ordinary. My pool guy is stating it just burned up......
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This pump was bought in March 2016 to replace a Hayward pump that was over 10 years old and we decided to buy Hayward again expecting a good quality pump that would last many seasons to come. One month into the 2017 season the pump is dead!! No suction, and a not so pleasant,loud grinding sound coming from the motor. A little over one month out of warranty and after reading other reviews I have no faith that a replacement pump will last long term.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly D.

customer_reviews.title: Last One Only Lasted a Few Years
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my second Super Pump. I'm not thrilled. The old one wasn't that old. It locked up, and rather than go through the misery of replacing the motor, I bought a whole new pump. It worked fine for a few years, but a product like this should run nearly forever. I only bought the second one because I'm moving, and I need a new pump that lines up with the existing pipes. They should put durable American motors on these things.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Caballero

customer_reviews.title: Pump failed catastrophically after one season.
customer_reviews.text: Pump warranty listed as 2 years on product page. My pump started making a horrible noise and died shortly after. It was 1.5 years old. Hayward gave me a run-around sending me to a dealer for help, yet the dealer wouldn’t bother since I bought the pump online. When I called back was told it has a one year warranty and I was out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: N. Haskovec

customer_reviews.title: Dead...2.5 years for the seals, 4 years for the pump
customer_reviews.text: Needed new seals at 2.5 years as the originals failed. That bought me another year and a half. Now, at 4 years, it just pops and trips the breaker when you try to turn it on. So much for paying extra for the good one...
customer_reviews.author: Steve K.

customer_reviews.title: 7 years old and still going strong.
customer_reviews.text: Bought and installed myself in 2014...6 years later and still going strong. I only replaced it because I went with a multi speed unit but it was still performing as new. For single speed it was very quiet. I noticed priced almost doubled as I paid about 3hundred and 50 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: ILoveOutdoors

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: We bought this pump for our in ground pool back in January 2015. Immediately the motor started rusting but still worked. It worked well up until yesterday when it seized up. most pumps should last 8-10 years. This one died in five. And it wasn't cheap.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I replace one of these pumps about every three years. They work great at first but the plastic fan inside eventually falls apart and causes the whole motor to overheat and fail. I've gotten to where I can replace them with my eyes closed, but I do wish Hayward would work on a solution to the problem. Other than that when they area new, these pumps are very strong and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Starnes

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pump and it has only been installed for 2 years and has now stopped working. The motor has completely stopped and will not turn on. The prior pump we had lasted about 10 years. I would not recommend this pump. I know pumps will wear out over time but should definitely last longer than 2 seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Look at warranty!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this pump June 29th, 2017 run great for the two months! I shut my pool down beginning of September because I live in Ohio, and reopened it the middle of May, 2018. The pump ran fine until begging of September 2018. Now it makes a loud winning noise before it trips my breaker. So the pump worked for 6 months. I call Hayward for support and to see if there was a warranty, and the person I spoke to told me my pump was out of warranty and there was nothing they could do to help!!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, I bought one and had to ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy, I bought one and had to send it back, when I got my new one it leaked in the same place right where the basket connects to the pump and they will not fix it. I've called all the places that they sent me to warranty the product with no luck.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from In The Swim
customer_reviews.text: The motor was fine. Except I ordered a 1.5 HP, when I needed a 2HP. My original motor was a 1.5, but since we moved the location of the filter and pump 20 feet father away...a more powerful motor was needed. Now comes the bad part. This company IN THE SWIM threatened me wi a 50% restocking fee because I didn’t send it back in the original box!!! What???
customer_reviews.author: wilson chery

customer_reviews.title: Good Pump
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a loud, hot - but still working 19 year old pump. I just installed mine yesterday, but I can tell you it's quiet and powerful. It was a bit more complicated hooking it up than I thought. To be safe I called an electrician who hooked it up. Something interesting that a pool guy suggested and I did that made it easier - I used a 3 ft section of flex hose. You might want to try that to save some time and aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: OSFANs

customer_reviews.title: lasted 4 months beyond warranty :(
customer_reviews.text: I under-used this product and it still only lasted 26 months. For half this price, I could have bought a no name brand with the same life span. I expect a product from Hayward to have brand reliability. DONT BUY THIS, choose something cheaper that will do the same job from another company. NEVER AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Price savings yes, annoying yes.
customer_reviews.text: This where I dislike Amazon buying. Small pieces that are broken (fortunately easy to replace because I took them off my old one!) but, not serious to send the entire pump back (which would be super annoying). Pictures often lack enough detail. Product writers people should really understand what they are writing about (as if they had to stall the product. Imagine that..)
customer_reviews.author: DY

customer_reviews.title: Bearing has gone bad after 3 years of use, other minor issue
customer_reviews.text: After 3 years of nightly use, a bearing in the motor appears to have gone bad. When running, it screams like a banshee. Also, the nuts used to fasten down the lid are made of plastic, so the threads got stripped pretty quickly. I expected to get more than 3 years out of this pump.
customer_reviews.author: Dribrats

customer_reviews.title: What a lemon.
customer_reviews.text: The pump lasted just over 2 months then went out. Now it needs replaced. Don't purchase as the warranty is only 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect for 6 years and bearings are whining now
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this hayward pump in 2013.....it sounds like the bearings are starting go after only six years... I only run it 8 hours a day 4 months out of the year. I'd expect it to last 8-10......not completely disappointed but it should have lasted a little longer than 6 years
customer_reviews.author: The bubba

customer_reviews.title: Relatively easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Replacing an older pump that will no longer hold prime. Easy connections. Only flaw with this newer version is the basket cover. It's more heavily tinted than previously, so you can't see if the basket has debris or not. I just reused the old clearer cover!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: POOR design and cheap specialized parts
customer_reviews.text: Poor design any designer knows you don't make rectangle seals they leak, if you need replacement parts you can't fix it yourself, you will need to buy special parts from Hayward Also the sealing screws are anchored in plastic swivel nuts which are easy to snap in summary very poor design and cheap parts make this a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: gene

customer_reviews.title: Pump lasted only 14 months
customer_reviews.text: We've been through several pumps, and never had one go bad this quickly. We ran it from mid-June of 2018 until late September, then June of this year until now. Expensive item for such a short life!
customer_reviews.author: NashvilleMimi

customer_reviews.title: A Good Replacement for My Old Hayward
customer_reviews.text: I have the older version of this pump (SP2600) that died (seized up) after more than 9 years. It has the same power rating of 1.5 horses and the connections size and orientation looked the same but one can never be sure until you install it. Bearing in mind that I am a DIY'er and have been for a few centuries and not a professionally trained plumber or electrician, the installation took me about an hour. It was easy to hook it up and and get it running, everything was an exact match. I see no downsides at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rick D. Huff

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I finally had to replace my last unit that I had for almost 15 years and it was weather beaten and worked hard for many summers and the bearings finally went so I bought a new one and it's all quiet again as it use to be.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M Texidor

customer_reviews.title: Caution - Buy extended warranty
customer_reviews.text: I recommend buying the extended warranty for this product. We've had ours just 2 months over a year (and probably only installed for a year) and the motor won't start. Warranty just ran out. Now we have to take it to a repair shop to see what's wrong. Purchased Hayward due to their good reputation. So much for that.
customer_reviews.author: SkunkLover27

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell
customer_reviews.text: I'm just not convinced Hayward makes them like they used to, I'll try to get back to you in time
customer_reviews.author: Van Kleyla

customer_reviews.title: Dont try to go cheap on a pool pump.
customer_reviews.text: This pump works great and was a direct replacement for my previous pump that finally died after 16 years of service. I wasted 2 months trying to install a cheaper pump and after much frustration I finally returned it and bought a Hayward. Wish I would have just bought this pump to begin with. Most of the time you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet and powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 5 stars simply because of how well it works and how quiet it is. My only negative comment is that the cover for the basket is not clear. It is a VERY SLIGHTLY translucent black. Which makes it very difficult to see inside without opening. The description says otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: K. Dawley

customer_reviews.title: Life span way too short
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in August, 2015. Ran great for a while, but it didn’t even make it through three seasons. Not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Fulks

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: After my circuit breaker failed and fried my previous pump, I made the decision to replace the entire pump with this product as opposed to replacing just the motor end. This way, not only is the motor new, but the plastic fittings that attaches to the motor. The pump works great with my 25,000 gallon pool.
customer_reviews.author: Save with Dave

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as Expected
customer_reviews.text: The product shipped quickly and it exactly as expected Nothing comes in the box except the pump & some installation instructions. There is no connection kit. This pump is louder than the pump it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: P. E. Raney

customer_reviews.title: Purchase a rebuilt one for way too much money. ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchase a rebuilt one for way too much money. Returned it. Corrosion on pump made me skeptical. Third party seller. Be Careful!
customer_reviews.author: Earl Tibbitts & Joan Tibbitts

customer_reviews.title: It runs surprisingly cool as well
customer_reviews.text: This pump has been running non stop for over a week and maintains its suction even with a full skimmer basket. My fiance keeps commenting on how quiet it is and I agree. It runs surprisingly cool as well. I have had many pumps but none of them have impressed me as much as this one.
customer_reviews.author: nv

customer_reviews.title: hooked right up
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older 1hp pump that was having problems, I figured I might as well just bite the bullet and do it right instead of putting good money after bad. It was very simple to install, I switched it over from 215 to 115v by just moving the jumper plug. The only thing is I really don't know if it is actually moving as much water as my old 1hp. I thought a new bigger pump would have noticeable increase in the jet flow, not the case. It actually is leaving more debris on the top of the water, I guess time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Really upset
customer_reviews.text: Four months of service - leaking - very loud as if motor is going. Have no idea what to purchase to replace - very upset I have to spend another 400.
customer_reviews.author: KAREN

customer_reviews.title: Pumps only last 2-3 years tops
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pump in six years. Can’t get more than two or three seasons out of these pumps. Running not even a full four months due to weather in our area. Price has also increased several hundred dollars. Might be able to justify price increase if the durability and quality would be improving along with it. Won’t be buying a Hayward anymore.
customer_reviews.author: C. Renger

customer_reviews.title: Bought 3 in nine years.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 iof this model n 9 years. Only continued buying this pump because it was the one we acquired from previous owners. Going with a new brand this time.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great Pump
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic pump for our inground pool. At a great price too. Our local poop place wanted $700 for the exact same pump. This one is self priming which is really nice too. It moves a lot of water. It arrived quicker than expected too.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Pump failed less than
customer_reviews.text: This product failed in less than a year, only was used for just over 5 months, installed on May 25,2016 used for one summer. Pool was closed professionally in October and re-opened May 14th 2017. On May 22nd 2017 it locked up and ceased to work.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Sloan

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to install and I replaced an existing Hayward RS ...
customer_reviews.text: New pump arrived and was packaged well. It was easy to install and I replaced an existing Hayward RS 1.5 HP pump. This new pump is very quiet. The basket is a lot smaller than the previous RS pump, but still adequate to catch leaves and debris. It has been running now for two weeks and no issues. This pump was less than 1/2 the price of another RS Hayward pump of the same HP and rating, so only time will tell if it lasts as long as the Hayward (7 years).
customer_reviews.author: rug

customer_reviews.title: Great Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Swapped out an older hayward northstar unit that was going bad. Had to adapt from 1.5 outlet to 2 inch piping near the pool equipment. Its a really good idea to use unions when installing this in case you ever need to take it out or want to store it for the winter. It has slightly less flow rate than the northstar but still works for my 30000 gallon pool. Much quieter than old northstar and the lid is much easier to open with the screw tabs
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE SEAL - DO NOT BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: This pump is a beast and I loved it at first. But within a week of its installation one of the seals sprung a leak and that's that. The product has been discontinued and I am unable to find a replacement seal. Between the product, shipping, and installation, I'm out nearly a thousand bucks. DO NOT BUY THIS MODEL.
customer_reviews.author: Hilltop Hacienda, LLC

customer_reviews.title: Hayward Pool Pump
customer_reviews.text: This pump is replacing my prior Hayward pump which was ruined by being underwater during a hurricane. I have since elevated the pump platform for the new Hayward. I have always had a good experience with Hayward products. The pump has a great reputation among my fellow pool owners. That's why I bought it as well as my own experience with Hayward pumps. This pump is an upgrade from my prior pump. I expect good things from it and am confident it will perform well.
customer_reviews.author: John E

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Brand new pump leaks like crazy between housing and motor. Do not buy tried to do warranty claim through Hayward had pump less than 2 months no response in 2 weeks from them after they asked for proof of purchase. Have 26000 gallon pool leaks bad enough have to fill up every other day bought pump brand new.
customer_reviews.author: john mclaurin

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump and a cover to protect it from the elements hoping to extend the life of this product, after a year and 2 months it failed when I called customer service it only had 1 year warranty. I will never buy a Hayward product again. Better off buy a cheaper brand with extended warranty.
customer_reviews.author: RAMON V.

customer_reviews.title: Motor screaming after less than 2 yrs
customer_reviews.text: Only has lasted me a little over a year. The bearings in the motor started screaming today. If I can get the company's help to fix I will update with a better review.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Junk.  Didn't make it 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Junk. First one lasted 4 years. Bought this one less than two years ago and its failing again and making a screeching sound.
customer_reviews.author: William G. Ganzel

customer_reviews.title: Great pump and the easyist to service.
customer_reviews.text: I moved here from a big city and was surprised to find this state was still using this old pump. But the more I serviced it the more I started to really like it. It is the easyist pump to repair if it ever needs fixing but rarely does. Only has 4 bolts to remove to pull the power end. This pump is cost effective and does a great job. Hayward got it right the first time !
customer_reviews.author: M Stu

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in how the product arrived. Sent in pictures with no response.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle Jones

customer_reviews.title: If you are even remotely handy, don't pay someone to install this for you
customer_reviews.text: You need to be able to shut off a breaker, remove screws, do a few plumbing connections and attach new wires to some leads. I saved myself hundreds of dollars by purchasing this directly from amazon and doing it myself. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: lowe f low  output
customer_reviews.text: Pump is grossly underpowered compared to previous cheaper pump of the same horsepower. I am seriously considering returning it and exchange it for a 2HP pump and just pay the difference. The pump is clearly quiet, and as easy to install as any other pump of this type
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: I made the fix and the unit works great.
customer_reviews.text: I was really hesitant to buy the pump online but the $$ I saved was huge and the equipment works as it should. I'm not mr handy but I was able to install it myself. I did have a minor issue that was my fault 100%. I run the pump on a 220 line. When you connect the wires you have to make sure that you plug them into the appropriate slots. Originally i connected them into the 120 slots so what I got was a ton of clicking sounds. I called the "support" line and they explained it to me right away. I made the fix and the unit works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Marsico

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Contacted Haward Customer service (e-mail) with a minor issue with a new pump and they responded quickly and solved the issues with 1 e-mail. Unheard of in today's atmosphere. Also, the pump is great. Runs silent and strong.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Imoto

customer_reviews.title: Well worth buying!
customer_reviews.text: Works great...my pool guy managed to install it very quickly and without any problems. Noise level is very low...price is very good after doing comparison checking.
customer_reviews.author: I. Newman

customer_reviews.title: What a quite pump
customer_reviews.text: After 38yrs our pool pump failed so I checked several sites and found this pump to be the same as the one we had. The price was right and prime shipping was great so I ordered it. All of the reviews I read said how quiet this pump was and boy were they right, I can now talk to my neighbor while standing next to it without yelling or shutting the pump off. The pressure is much better then the old one (it's been dying for a few years). We are very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We have been in this house over 30 years now ...
customer_reviews.text: We have been in this house over 30 years now. The first couple of pumps we had are long forgotten but the last two prior to this one lasted 20 years total. So we are going with another, which will be our third. Maybe it will last a decade too.
customer_reviews.author: J. O'Meara

customer_reviews.title: This is a waaayyy 0verpriced piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was the premiere brand of pool pumps. Not so! Pump motor crapped out at two years of age. i also bought Amazon protection plan for $65. Paid me $375 original purchase price when they realized replacement cost was $600. Don't be suckered in like I was.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Hayward is as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This pump provides the necessary pressures to circulate water thru my pool and filter better than the old pump could. After a year, I see no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: John E Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable, warranty is waste and almost scam
customer_reviews.text: The motor stopped working exactly after 3 years. It was overheat, and dead. I purchase warranty for 5 years(Asurion LLC). It’s been 7 days that they keep asking questions but do not help me to find a solution. Big frustration and disappointment!!
customer_reviews.author: RAFAEL L.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Nice pump. My pump sits up hill from my pool so was very pleased how easy this pump self primes even coming up hill. Just takes a minute or two to fully prime. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Good pump, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: My pool guy wanted to charge me $500 for a pump and another $300 to install it. This is a great pump for the money and was easy to install. I saved over $400 by doing it myself. I've only had it for a few months, but, assuming it doesn't crap out on me anytime soon, I would buy this pump again.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly quiet pump!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a difference! This pump was ordered to replace a dying Pentair Challenger pump. Had to change up the plumbing fittings, but expected as much. Installation is pretty straight forward, even with changing the way it sat on the pad. I expected a reduction in noise, but this is an absolutely incredible change! The pump is so quiet, especially in comparison to the dying old one, that the change is hard to even put into words. I think the best way to describe it is that you can have a conversation standing next to the running pump without having to raise your voice at all. Longevity will be determined, but expect we will get many years of service.
customer_reviews.author: Toler

customer_reviews.title: short lived for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine, used for my pool's waterfall but after 4 years and 3 months of rare use, the motor housing rusted through and it smoked and died. I live in humid Houston but none of my other, much cheaper pumps have ever rusted like that in less than 7 or 8 years.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Brown

customer_reviews.title: Came with bad part.
customer_reviews.text: This pump came with a faulty seal. After spending hundreds of dollars trying to figure out the problem, turns out it was the seal on the brand new pump. Amazon was great and helped us out with a partial refund, but I could not believe something like this happened with a reputable brand. Very disappointing. Works fine now that we replaced the part.
customer_reviews.author: maribeth

customer_reviews.title: The motor seems like it was built with good quality parts.
customer_reviews.text: Great motor at a good price. It fit right in place of my other one that lasted 10 on a salt water pool. The mother runs smooth and it’s very quiet Great product built correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pool pump
customer_reviews.text: Great motor and pump already assembled easy to install with little or no experience. Great replacement but another one did not last very long this one is much more solid
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Durable and cost efficient.
customer_reviews.text: As a pool professional, I recommended Hayward super pumps for their durability and ease of use. Anyone that has struggled with a hard to open strainer top, will appreciate how easy the Hayward is to open. The motors seem to last longer than any others I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of hp and thp ratings!! They aren’t necessarily as they appear.
customer_reviews.text: Nice pump and Amazon did good job. I’m disappointed that I didn’t understand the significant differentiation in HP measurement. Even though it’s rated 1.5 hp it operates lower and doesn’t match 2.5 thp and total pumping power of previous Hayward pump1.5 hp. Very confusing hp rating system for pool pumps!!
customer_reviews.author: bill brokaw

customer_reviews.title: Saved several Hundred dollars
customer_reviews.text: The unit was less expensive than others because of damaged goods. The damage was very minute and runs as it should ... like new. Awesome deal
customer_reviews.author: cambo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on amazon warehouse as open box, brand new but with dent in motor cover. Hooked it up and ran alright. My last super pump lasted 25 yrs. Quality product, great company.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Angarano

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pump!!!
customer_reviews.text: My old pump was leaking all over the place. Replaced the housing gasket and still no improvement so, I figured I'd just get a new pump and be done with it. This Hayward 1.5 Hp pump is very nice and much quieter than my old one. Added a new Hayward C1200 cartridge filter as well and re-piped the entire layout to clean things up a bit. Everything came out beautifully and all the leaks are now gone. Built an 8' x 6' enclosure to protect the equipment from the elements and all is good. My pool has never been cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: DeanP66

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pump!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to replace our old (it was really not so old) 1.25 hp pool pump. This has been a great improvement! The extra .25 hp really boosted the circulation and filtration of the pool water. We also purchased a couple of new filters at the same time and we are pleasantly amazed at how sparkling clean the pool stays now.
customer_reviews.author: FLGardener

customer_reviews.title: Great Basic Pool Pump
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this pump. I did some research online when my old pump went out. This model seemed to be a good basic pump with good reviews and the price was very good. I was changing to this Hayward pump from a Sta-rite model. I had no problem installing this pump myself. The electrical connection was very straightforward. The plumbing matched the dimensions of my existing system - but I did have to raise the pump up four inches. This Hayward pump is working great! I like the ease of cleaning the strainer basket and I think the pump looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis_F

customer_reviews.title: Good pump
customer_reviews.text: Old pool pump hit the dusty trail. This pump was a direct replacement and has been working great for the past month
customer_reviews.author: Master Ip

customer_reviews.title: Does not last long
customer_reviews.text: Motor burnt out about 15 months. Expect a little more quality from this company. Not sure why so many good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Motor
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old worn motor with this one and have not had any issues after 6 months of use. Bigger motor than my last and have also not had an increase on my electric bill running on the same schedule. I see no reason not to recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Mccloud

customer_reviews.title: Exact fit as 1 Hp
customer_reviews.text: Bought for 18 x 36 in-ground pool. My 1 Hp Hayward was over 20 years old and cracked at the pump housing bolts. I replaced it a with 1.5 Hp and got this one "Used - Like New" from Amazon Warehouse deals , about 15% off! Looked new, never hooked up with factory box and packing. Maybe someone ordered by mistake and returned. Just make sure you have 1-1/2 inch PVC to use this pump. I run it half the time as the 1 HP pump and get better results. Awesome flow to the pool returns and better skimmer action.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgiaYankee

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pump
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump as a replacement for one I didn't think was doing the job. This pump made all the difference in the quality of our pool water. It moves so much more water than my old pump and clean out is very easy. The improved pump also does a much better job of backwashing the DE filter material. I'm very happy with this pump and would recommend it highly to anyone looking for a new or replacement pump.
customer_reviews.author: W. Hall

customer_reviews.title: This is a very poor quality Pump.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very poor quality Pump. It is not working. I don't recommend anyone to buy this item.
customer_reviews.author: MOHAN

customer_reviews.title: No power cord!!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know that it didn’t come with a power cord. It has no place that I could see where it says where to buy one or what kind.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Dozier

customer_reviews.title: perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Im glad that I purchased this pump. Way cheaper then Aloha, Also same pump. Runs great!
customer_reviews.author: April

product_meta.title: Hayward SP2610X15 Super Pump 1.5 HP Pool Pump
product_meta.description:
Size:1.5 HP (SP2610X15)| Style:Pool Pump

 The Hayward Super Pump large-capacity, technologically advanced pump blends cost-efficient design with durable construction, setting the standard for excellence and value. Designed for in ground pools and spas of all types and sizes, the Super Pump features a totally balanced, efficient Noryl impeller to produce higher flow rates at less horsepower than other pumps, so you can run your pump less and save on electricity. Super-sized 110 cubic-inch basket has extra leaf-holding capacity and extends time between cleanings. Rigid construction with load extender ribbing assures free flowing operation for heavy debris loads. Exclusive swing-aside hand knobs make strainer cover removal simple and easy. Lexan see-thru strainer cover lets you see when the basket needs cleaning. All components molded of corrosion-proof PermaGlass XL for extra durability and long life. 

 This large capacity pool pump combines durable corrosion-proof construction with state-of-the-art performance for years of trouble-free service. It easily installs on existing in-ground pool systems with a unique, stable mounting base for additional versatility. Rugged, one-piece housing, with full-flow ports, assures rapid priming and continuous operation. Service-ease design gives simple access to all internal parts. Motor and entire drive group assembly can be removed, without disturbing pipe or mounting connections, by disengaging just four bolts. Super Pump combines proven performance with quiet, efficient and dependable operation. 



AMAZON.COM


Efficient, dependable circulation pump for in-ground pools of all types and sizes. view larger Diagram. view larger Super-size 110-cubic-inch basket has extra leaf-holding capacity and extends time between cleanings. view larger HAYWARD SUPER PUMP
Efficient. Dependable. Proven. The Super Pump has all the quality features you expect from Hayward. Designed for in-ground pools and spas of all types and sizes, Super Pump features a large see-through strainer cover, a super-size debris basket, and an exclusive service-ease design for extra convenience. Super Pump combines proven performance with quiet, efficient and dependable operation.

HIGHLIGHTS
 * Heavy-duty, high-performance motor with air-flow ventilation for quieter, cooler operation
 * Exclusive swing-away hand knobs for easier strainer cover removal: no tools required, no loose parts, no clamps
 * See-through strainer cover lets you see when the basket needs to be cleaned and eliminated guesswork; special self-adjusting seal ensures dependable sealing
 * 110-cubic-inch basket has extra leaf-holding capacity; load-extender ribbing ensures free-flowing operation
 * Service-ease design gives simple access to all internal parts
 * Self-priming (suction lift up to 10-feet above water level)
 * Heat-resistant, industrial-size ceramic seal is long-wearing and drip proof
 * Mounting base provides stable, stress-free support, plus versatility for any installation requirement; adapts 48- and 56-frame motors

PERFORMANCE DATA
Max Rated Model No. Pump Output (GPM) vs. Total Resistance to Flow (Feet of Head) 20 ft 30 ft 40 ft 50 ft 60 ft 70 ft SP2600X5 48 38 23 -- -- -- SP2605X7 61 52 41 25 -- -- SP2607X10 74 65 54 40 9 -- SP2610X15 83 75 65 53 36 -- SP2615X20 122 111 98 84 66 38 SP2621X25 117 107 97 86 74 58 PERFORMANCE DATA - LOW SPEED
Max Rated Model No. Pump Output (GPM) vs. Total Resistance to Flow (Feet of Head) 5 ft 10 ft 15 ft 20 ft 25 ft 30 ft SP2607X102S 39 29 13 -- -- -- SP2610X152S 41 32 18 -- -- -- SP2615X202S 63 51 35 -- -- -- GENERAL FAQ'S FOR ALL HAYWARD PUMPS
HOW DOES MY IN-GROUND PUMP OPERATE?
 * Hayward in-ground pumps are self-priming centrifugal pumps. These pumps have a vacuum chamber, commonly known as a pump housing. The pump housing must be filled with water in order to create a vacuum, resulting in the pump drawing the water out of your pool or spa. The pump housing will remain full of water while the pump is on, and will remain full or partially full when the pump is shut off.
 * When powered on, the motor will begin to rotate. Two-speed pumps will power on a pre-selected speed or with some controllers, it will cycle at high before changing to the lower speed. The motor spins the pump impeller, located inside the pump volute. While the motor is rotating, the tips of the impeller are hydraulically sealed inside the pump diffuser, which is responsible for self-priming.
 * Self-priming can only occur if the pump has a diffuser--all in ground Hayward pumps have an internal diffuser. It helps to eliminate any air approaching into the pump housing from the suction piping. As all the air is removed from the system, you will notice bubbles returning to the pool through the return fittings. A full prime occurs when the bubbles stop returning to the pool and the pump basket is full of water. The filter pressure will rise as the pump reaches full prime. The actual gallons per minute (GPM) vary with the type of pump, horsepower, pipe size, distance from pool and other restrictions within the plumbing system.
 * Hayward self-priming pumps are very dependable and simple in design. They require a sufficient supply of water from the pool or spa, and no air in the suction lines. Air could come from a loose strainer cover, a leak in any valve, a pinhole in any suction line or a crack or loose connections in the underground piping.

DO I NEED TO HAVE A STRAINER BASKET IN MY PUMP POT?
 * Yes. Without the strainer basket, debris will clog the impeller in the pump volute causing the pump to cease moving water. Be sure to clean your strainer basket, as well as the skimmer baskets, so water flow is not obstructed and the pump is not overworked.

HOW DO I WINTERIZE MY PUMP?
 * To winterize a Hayward Pool pump, turn off the electrical circuit breaker that supplies power to the pump. Also, make sure that there is NO water left inside the pump. All Hayward pumps are equipped with drain plugs that will allow excess water to drain once the plugs are removed. Contact your local Hayward dealer for proper winterization procedures.

HOW MANY HOURS PER DAY SHOULD I RUN MY PUMP?
 * There are many factors to consider; bather load, gallons of water, pump horsepower, type and size of filter just to name a few. A good guideline is 8-10 hours a day. On the cooler days and early and late season, you can cut the run time down to 4-6 hours because there is usually less swimmers and cooler water requires less chemicals. In peak season, when it is the hottest, raising the run time to 10-12 hours per day will help to keep the pool clean and circulating during it's time of heaviest use.
